## Roadmap {data-background=green.jpg data-background-size=cover}

- What _are_ torts?
- Intentional torts
	+ E.g., assault and battery
- Negligence
	+ Unintentional carelessness which results in harm
- Strict liability
	+ Briefly, as we will cover during product liability


## What is a tort? {data-background=green.jpg data-background-size=cover}

<p style="font-size:50px;padding: 80px 0;"> 
<em>A tort is a legally-actionable wrong.</em> If you or your property has been injured by another, tort law is likely your remedy.</p>


## What’s the point? First, make you whole {data-background=green.jpg data-background-size=cover}

- Put you in the same position as if there had been no tort
- Compensatory damages
	+ _Special_ damages = we can put a price tag on it
		+ Medical expenses, lost wages
	+ _General_ damages = harder to put a price tag on
		+ Pain and suffering
		+ Loss of companionship
		+ Disfigurement

## What’s the point? At times, punish {data-background=green.jpg data-background-size=cover}
- _Punitive_ damages
	+ Punish the wrongdoer
	+ Generally only available for intentional torts and gross negligence, with a higher degree of culpability
	+ Due process limitations ....



# Intentional Torts

## Battery {data-background=green.jpg data-background-size=cover}

 _Battery_ is ...

 - unauthorized
 - intentional
 	+ actual intent, or
 	+ substantial certainty
 - harmful or offensive 
 - physical contact 
 - with another person or their immediate property.

## Assault {data-background=green.jpg data-background-size=cover}

_Assault_ is ...

- intent to cause
- the **threat** of immediate harm or offensive contact

# Negligence

## Elements of _negligence_ {data-background=green.jpg data-background-size=cover}

- A duty of care
- That was breached 
- That caused
	+ But for _and_ proximate
- Actual damage or loss
